models

Class Player

  • java.lang.Object
    • models.Player

  • public class Player
extends java.lang.Object
    Create one player including the value of life, money etc. Applying singleton pattern to ensure there is only one player at any time.
    Version:
    v1.0.0
    Author:
    HaoZhang

      • setLives

        public void setLives(int l)
        The method to set the life value of this player.
        Parameters:
        l - An integer as the life value of this player.

      • setMoney

        public void setMoney(int m)
        The method to set the life value of this player.
        Parameters:
        m - An integer as the money value of this player.

      • addToMoney

        public void addToMoney(int moneyToAdd)
        The method to add some money to the money of this player
        Parameters:
        moneyToAdd - An integer as the amount of money to add.

      • takeAwayALife

        public void takeAwayALife()
        The method to decrease the life value of this player. It subtracts 1 from the life value.

      • getStartingLives

        public static int getStartingLives()
        Get the start value of life of this player.
        Returns:
        STARTINGLIVES

      • getStartingMoney

        public static int getStartingMoney()
        Get the start value of money of this player.
        Returns:
        STARTINGMONEY

      • resetStats

        public void resetStats()
        Reset the value of life and money to start value. The value of life is set to STARTINGLIVES. The value of money is set to STARTINGMONEY.
